results.title: Touch the Sun : Captain Johnno (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Touch the Sun Series”.
Johnno, an energetic and sensitive 10 year old, resides in a small coastal fishing town. His father’s inability to come to terms with Johnno’s deafness exacerbates their already troubled relationship. To curb Johnno’s rebelliousness his father proposes to send him to a “special school”. On learning of this plan Johnno flees to a nearby island to live like Robinson Crusoe. An Italian fisherman, who has earlier befriended Johnno, finds him on the island and endeavours to persuade him to return and face his problems. Rated: G
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Touch the Sun : The Gift
results.creator_credit: Paul Cox, Tony Llewellyn-Jones and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Nicos and Sofia, two city kids, strike it lucky in a lottery. Their prize is five hundred hectares of beautiful bushland in Western Australia. Together with their grandfather the children travel West to discover the mystery and magic of their land not expecting to discover a darker side to their new found fortune.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Cox, Tony Llewellyn-Jones and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Touch the Sun: Top enders
results.creator_credit: Michael Aitkens, Jackie McKimmie, Jill Robb and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Alice, a runaway from home, meets on the road Mick, a boy in pursuit of his uncle. Stealing a car they traverse a treacherous stretch of desert road. When the car runs out of petrol they set out on foot only to become lost. With the harsh desert conditions threatening their survival Alice and Mick reflect on their actions and the families they have fled from. Cast includes John Jarratt, Madeleine Blackwell, Bennendine Woods, Donald Dale.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Devil's Hill
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Jill Robb, Revcom Television, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Sam and his sisters come to stay on their cousin’s remote farm in Tasmania. Badge, the farm boy, feels daunted by the arrival of his arrogant city cousins. After a huge violent storm, the prize cow escapes. The children decide to search the mountainous wilderness for the cow and their route leads up to the mysterious Devil’s Hill. The adventure teaches them they must stick together to survive. Based on the novel by Nan Chauncy.
Cast includes Peter Hehir, Mary Haire, John Flaus, Alexander Jacobs, Emma Pugh, Cameron Atkins and Jane McArthur.

results.title: Touch the Sun : Princess Kate
results.creator_credit: George Ogilvie and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Thirteen year old Kate’s world is turned topsy turvy when she learns she is adopted. Unaware of the pain she is causing her adoptive family, Kate searches for her “real” parents. Her unexpected arrival on the doorstep of her natural mother stirs up mixed emotions. Kate succeeds in befriending her half-sister May before returning home to her adoptive parents with a new understanding of herself and her relationships. Rated: G

results.title: Circus
results.brief_description: Documentary about life on the road with the Swiss Circus Royale as it tours outback Australia. Intercuts performance scenes with shots of the less glamorous aspects of circus life. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Be smart... don't start
results.brief_description: Especially designed for elementary grades at school, this film looks at cigarette smoking and the hazards of starting the habit. It presents opposing opinions and claims of cigarette manufacturers and medical men in an effort to create a lifetime mental attitude toward smoking at this critical age level.

results.title: Green Fingers: Drainage
results.brief_description: ‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Drainage’, gardener Rod Cantrill describes the importance of well-drained soil in the home garden. Cantrill demonstrates how to lay agricultural drainage pipes to remove excess water from the soil, and how to raise garden beds as an alternative method. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.

results.title: The Blinds and the Shutters
results.brief_description: This works presents a virtual world comprised of a modernist fictional house in a remote forest setting, whose contents gradually spill and float out of every aperture. Shoes and dresses, pots and pans, cutlery, pillows, blankets and plates journey in two directions simultaneously, some disappearing into the distance never to return, others appearing across all four screens in the installation. The larger objects fade up like apparitions, disappear and then reappear in strange locations, breaking all logic that is guiding this imaginary world. The slow drift of these household objects around the four screens is uncanny. While their journey suggests that the natural phenomenon of air is present, there is also a sense of airlessness; a claustrophobic, almost heavily scented environment. Despite sharing an energy force within the virtual environment, these objects are estranged – for they have lost their domestic relationship with one another. The sounds of bumps, collisions and muffled shuffles emerging from the interior of the house underscores the mystery of this scene. The disturbing atmosphere is most bizarre when the household goods are propelled into outer space, taking on the form of miniature satellites presumably tracking our behaviour from afar.

results.title: Innamorati
results.brief_description:
Assembled from family photographs, home movies and background music, Roberta Ciabarra narrates a poignant story of her parent’s courtship and unusual marriage as they migrate separately to Australia to establish a new life.

First created as part of the pilot 3 day digital storytelling workshop conducted at Cinemedia by Nina Mullen and Joe Lambert from the Center for Digital Storytelling, Berkeley, CA.
